title: Quiz 3: Community Health Nursing - June 2022 FQE
description: Complete Final Qualifying Examination from June 2022 covering Management, Epidemiology, Family Health, and Reproductive Health.

questions.question: According to Abraham Maslow the most elevated type of need is:

options.text: Social
Self esteem
Safety
Self-actualization

questions.explanation: In Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs, Self-actualization (the realization of one's full potential) is at the very top (pinnacle) of the pyramid, above physiological, safety, social, and esteem needs.

questions.question: The human resource document that outlines the qualification required for the job holder is:

options.text: Job announcement
Job specification
Job application
Job portfolio

questions.explanation: Job Specification outlines the minimum qualifications, skills, and traits required to perform the job (the human requirements), whereas Job Description outlines the duties.

questions.question: Leadership is defined as:

options.text: Assigning subordinates to work
Getting work done through other people
A process of influencing the activities of a group or individual to accomplish goals
A process which is static and directly responsible for achieving the organizational goals

questions.explanation: Leadership is fundamentally about influence. While management involves getting work done (Option B), leadership is the art of inspiring and influencing others towards a shared vision.

questions.question: The primary aim of anti-retroviral therapy is to:

options.text: Increase CD4 cell count in the client
Reduce CD4 cell count in the client
Increase the libido of the patient
Increase the viral load in the client

questions.explanation: The mechanism of ART is to suppress the Viral Load. The clinical result/aim of this suppression is the recovery of the immune system, indicated by an increase in CD4 cell count.

questions.question: Census is one of the methods used in measuring population. The best method of doing this is to:

options.text: Go from house to house gathering information from the head of the household
Gather everyone in one place and count them
Count the houses and multiply by the average number of the occupants
Record all the births and deaths as soon as these occur

questions.explanation: This describes the Canvasser Method (enumerators visit households), which is generally considered more accurate and is the standard for national censuses.

questions.question: The process of carrying out a community diagnosis includes:

options.text: Provide sufficient time and authority
Define the task, responsibilities and authority
Provide sufficient time and authority
Choose the willing person

questions.explanation: Within the context of organizing a team for diagnosis, defining tasks and responsibilities is a crucial management step.

questions.question: After population census, population by sex and age is usually presented in the form of:

options.text: Pyramid
Pie chart
Linear graph
Bar chart

questions.explanation: The Population Pyramid is the standard graphical representation for the age-sex structure of a population.

questions.question: Some elements of primary health care that may be utilized in primary prevention of illness are:

options.text: Health education, local disease control, supply of essential drugs
Health education, proper nutrition, expanded programme of immunization
Treatment of minor ailments, sanitation and safe water, maternal child health/family planning
Mental health, local disease control, treatment of endemic diseases

questions.explanation: Primary prevention aims to prevent disease before it occurs. This includes Health Education, Nutrition, and Immunization. Other options include treatment (secondary/tertiary).

questions.question: Some of the community resources that can be utilized in rehabilitation of a person with moderate mental retardation:

options.text: Special school, juvenile courts, family
Children's home, family, juvenile courts
Sheltered workshop, youth centre, children's home
Special school, sheltered workshop, family

questions.explanation: Resources include Special Schools (education), Sheltered Workshops (vocational training), and the Family (support). Courts are legal entities.

questions.question: Shortage of supplies in a unit would be due to:

options.text: Destruction by the patients
Dishonesty and theft by staff members
Poor inventory keeping by the unit in-charge
Poor management of the unit

questions.explanation: The most common systemic management cause of shortages is poor inventory keeping (failure to track stock levels and re-order points).

questions.question: Select the TRUE statements from the following:

options.text: In prevention of mother to child transmission of HIV, the baby should be given Nevirapine within 72 hours following birth
Cervicitis is usually caused by Chlamydia and Candida

questions.explanation: Statement A is True: Infant prophylaxis starts within 72 hours. Statement B is False: Cervicitis is caused by Chlamydia and Gonorrhea; Candida causes vaginitis.
questions.hint: Consider the causes of cervicitis vs vaginitis.

questions.question: Delegation is the process of:

options.text: Transferring responsibility and accountability to a junior person
Enabling a person to perform assigned duties to the best of his/her ability
Transferring responsibility and authority for performing a task
Authorising subordinates to do or refrain from doing something

questions.explanation: Delegation involves transferring responsibility and authority, but the delegator retains accountability.
questions.hint: What is transferred and what is retained?

questions.question: Internal time wasting is said to occur if a manager:

options.text: Has poor communication skills
Does not give feed back
Is indecisive
Is involved in socializing

questions.explanation: Internal time wasters are generated by the person themselves, such as indecision or procrastination.

questions.question: A mission statement of an organisation states the:

options.text: Fundamental goals of the organisation
Purpose of its existence
Output of the planned activities
Future plans of the organisation

questions.explanation: A mission statement answers 'Why do we exist?'. Future plans relate to Vision.

questions.question: Performance indicators reflect the:

options.text: Amount of work accomplished by an employee in one day
Work allocation in a specific shift
Number of days an employee has been on duty in a given period of time
Critical success factors of an organisation

questions.explanation: Performance indicators measure the output or efficiency of work performed against standards.

questions.question: The following would be done to a child who comes to MCH clinic at six weeks without a BCG scar after BCG vaccination at birth?

options.text: Repeat BCG vaccine along other vaccines
Repeat BCG vaccine after twelve weeks from that day
Check scar after twelve weeks of birth
Advice mother to keep observing for the scar formation

questions.explanation: A BCG scar can take up to 3 months (12 weeks) to form. Check at 12 weeks; if absent then, re-vaccinate.

questions.question: The contraceptive method recommended for a client with a history of deep venous thrombosis is:

options.text: Copper T 380A
Combined oral pills
Bilateral tubaligation
Implants

questions.explanation: Estrogen is contraindicated in DVT. Copper T is non-hormonal and MEC Category 1 (safest). Implants are safe but Copper T avoids hormones entirely.

questions.question: The most effective way to give community feedback following community survey is through:

options.text: Community Baraza
Medical camp
Posting findings in a reputable journal
Preparing a report at the health facility

questions.explanation: A 'Baraza' (community meeting) allows for face-to-face communication and discussion, making it the most participatory method.

questions.question: The nurses' role in community participation is:

options.text: Mobilize community using available resources
To ensure the availability of resources
To educate the members on use of the available resources
Mobilize the community for behaviour change using the available resources

questions.explanation: Mobilization is the active process of organizing the community to identify needs and take action.

questions.question: Health messages a community health nurse shares with a family regarding social functions include:

options.text: Provision of food, provision of shelter, provision of security
Provision of clothing, transmission of folkways, transmission of ideas
Sexual relationship, provision of shelter, rearing of children
Medical care, provision of security, transmission of culture

questions.explanation: Social functions involve socialization and cultural transmission (folkways, ideas). Food/shelter are physical/biological functions.

questions.question: Antenatal history taken from a mother who brings a 2-year-old child to the clinic with complaints of poor sight include:

options.text: Birth injuries, cerebral malaria, blindness
Antenatal haemorrhage, chemotherapy, diabetes mellitus
Severe malnutrition, cerebral palsy, mental sub-normality
Premature birth, difficult labour, severe malnutrition

questions.explanation: Premature birth (risk of Retinopathy of Prematurity) and difficult labour (hypoxia) are key perinatal risk factors for vision issues.

questions.question: The incidence rate of malaria in community X with a population of 50,000 people where new cases were 3,000 and old cases 1,000 is:
questions.explanation: Incidence = (New Cases / Total Population) x 100. (3,000 / 50,000) x 100 = 6%.

questions.question: While counselling a group of youths on smoking, you note two responses 'My father aged 65 years has no history of hypertension and there is no history of cancer in my family'. The defence mechanism being portrayed is:

options.text: Projection
Reaction formation
Sublimation
Rationalization

questions.explanation: Rationalization is finding logical reasons to justify unacceptable behavior.

questions.question: Provisional diagnosis for Mr. Juma who is brought to the clinic complaining of sudden onset of nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, abdominal cramps and general weakness two hours after eating a meal is:

options.text: Salmonella food poisoning
Clostridium botulinum food poisoning
Staphylococcus aureus food poisoning
Bacillus cereus food poisoning

questions.explanation: Staph aureus toxins cause rapid onset of symptoms (1-6 hours). Salmonella takes longer.

questions.question: As a community health nurse serving community B, you discover that they have improperly constructed pit latrines. Your advice regarding appropriate construction will include:

options.text: The latrine should be 30m or more above water source, floor should preferably be concrete slab
It should be 15m or more above water source, the roof should be iron sheets
The floor should preferably be of concrete slab, the depth of pit should be 2-3m deep
The roof should be grass thatched, 30m or more below water source

questions.explanation: Standard guidelines require pit latrines to be at least 30 meters away from water sources.

questions.question: Some roles of a nurse in logistics management include:

options.text: Purchase goods, keep inventory
Keep inventory, maintain stock level
Procure items promptly, issue items to staff
Purchase items, keep inventory

questions.explanation: Nurses manage inventory and stock levels; purchasing/procurement is usually an administrative role.

questions.question: Average number of days recommended for abstinence by a couple using ovulation as a family planning method are:
questions.explanation: In the Standard Days Method, the fertile window is days 8-19, totaling 12 days.

questions.question: A programme of community health action must have the following characteristics:

options.text: Distribution of population by social groups, attack rates of major diseases
Effectively utilize all available resources, full participation of the community
Coordinate efforts of all agencies, distribution of population in professional groups
Spheres of factors responsible for health problems, health felt needs of the community

questions.explanation: Successful programs rely on community participation and efficient resource utilization.

questions.question: Demographical information to be obtained during community diagnosis include:

options.text: Vital health events, total families
Total population, leadership structure
Channels of communication, social organizations
Specific vulnerable groups, housing factors

questions.explanation: Demography deals with population statistics like vital events (births/deaths) and total numbers.

questions.question: Disease incidence rate:

options.text: Is particularly important as an indication of the need for preventive measures
Measures the rate at which new cases are occurring in the population
Often takes into account the population at risk in the middle of the year
Is concerned with how long the disease lasts in the population

questions.explanation: Incidence strictly measures the rate of new cases.

questions.question: Termination of home visits occurs when the nurse has:

options.text: Used talents to make family to be receptive to their health problems
Gathered information about the family and have established perception of purpose
Nurse-patient goals are reached, health is restored and there is riper functioning
Have utilized the assistance of other members to provide health care services

questions.explanation: Termination is appropriate when set goals are achieved and the client is independent.

questions.question: Herd immunity is:

options.text: Immunity which develops when a group people are vaccinated together
Immunity induced by vaccines which are multi-dose
Immunity which develops in non-immunized persons who are in a community well vaccinated
Immunity developed in humans after using vaccines tested on the herds of animals

questions.explanation: Herd immunity provides indirect protection to non-immune individuals when a large percentage of the population is immune.

questions.question: Medical eligibility, criteria category 3 for using combined oral contraceptives includes:

options.text: Post-abortion women within 5 days, women with symptomatic gall bladder disease
Breast-feeding mothers before six weeks post-partum, women with severe dysmenorrhoea
Women with a history of ectopic pregnancy, women who smoke more than 15 cigarettes a day and are 35 years old
Breast-feeding mothers before six months post-partum, women with moderate hypertension B/P 140/90 mmHg

questions.explanation: Breastfeeding 6wks-6mos and Hypertension 140/90 are MEC Category 3 (Risks > Benefits). Smoking >35yrs is Category 4.

questions.question: Tort law is:

options.text: Law made by administrative agencies about who will get the resources and who will not
Law enacted by legislative branch of government
Law derived from earlier decisions made by courts
Law that addresses wrongfully acts, whether unintentional or intentional against a person or property

questions.explanation: A tort is a civil wrong resulting in legal liability, covering negligence and malpractice.

questions.question: Common challenges which face the community development worker include:

options.text: Accountability, funding, acceptability
Role of the professional, evaluation methods, community action
Strategic support, citizen control mechanism, formal participation
Development of plans, empowerment of individuals, social stratification

questions.explanation: Funding, accountability, and community acceptability are key practical challenges.

questions.question: The main roles of Controller and Auditor-General include:

options.text: Ensures efficient utilization of public funds, approve withdrawal from consolidated fund
Give report on public accounts, prepare and examine vouchers
Supervises collection of Government revenue, provides custody of Harambee funds
Issues and controls imprests, prepares expenditure returns

questions.explanation: This office oversees the public purse, ensuring efficiency and approving withdrawals.

questions.question: Select the TRUE statements regarding family planning methods:

options.text: Standard Days method is appropriate for women with menstrual cycles between 26 â€“ 32 days long
Cyclofem is a combined injectable contraceptive given once after every 30 days

questions.explanation: SDM is for 26-32 day cycles. Cyclofem is a monthly combined injectable. (Note: The source text Q37 asked to identify True/False, with 'a' being False in the source because it said 'not appropriate'. I have corrected the option text to be a True statement for this selection format or kept source logic. Source said: 'a) SDM is NOT appropriate... (False)'. Therefore, 'SDM IS appropriate' is True. I will present the positive facts).

questions.question: Stumbling blocks to successful application of forecasting are:

options.text: Lack of skills required to effective forecasting, effective communication between user and preparer
Effective communication between user and preparer, company's forecasting status needs
Lack of skills required for effective forecasting, ability to plan a progressive set of actions
Lacking effective communication between user and preparer, lack of skills required for effective forecasting

questions.explanation: Forecasting fails due to lack of skills and poor communication between preparers and users.

questions.question: A group's norms and roles directly influence the:

options.text: Productivity, effective leadership
Satisfaction of group members, productivity
Productivity, skills to incorporate into leadership
Participation, best ideas with your group

questions.explanation: Group dynamics determine productivity and member satisfaction.

questions.question: Arrange the stages of a sewerage treatment plant in sequence order:
questions.explanation: Sequence: Inlet -> Primary -> Secondary -> Tertiary.

questions.question: During a home visit to a poor family with a child suffering from PEM, what activities can you undertake? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Nutritional Counseling (Balanced meals with local foods)
Establishment of a Kitchen Garden
Linkage to Social Support Services
Ignoring the poverty issue
Demonstration of food preparation

questions.explanation: Interventions include education on affordable nutrition, kitchen gardening for food security, and referral for social support.

questions.question: How does a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS Stage 3 in a breadwinner affect the family physically? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Reduced Labor/Income leading to lack of food/shelter
Physical exhaustion of caregivers
Risk of opportunistic infections to family members
Increased social status

questions.explanation: Physical effects include loss of basic needs due to income loss, caregiver fatigue, and infection risk.

questions.question: Strategies to create awareness among youth to reduce drug abuse include: (Select all that apply)

options.text: School Health Programmes
Sports and Recreational Activities
Peer Education
Social Media Campaigns
Community Barazas

questions.explanation: Awareness strategies include schools, sports, peer education, digital platforms, and community forums.

questions.question: Ways to reduce water-associated diseases in a slum include: (Select all that apply)

options.text: Water Treatment (Boiling/Chlorination)
Safe Storage of water
Drainage Management
Proper Sanitation (Latrines)
Open defecation

questions.explanation: Key interventions: Treatment, storage, drainage, and sanitation.

questions.question: Which conditions are necessary for Lactational Amenorrhea Method (LAM) to be effective? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Amenorrhea (No menses)
Exclusive Breastfeeding on demand
Infant aged less than 6 months
Infant aged more than 6 months
Mixed feeding

questions.explanation: The 3 criteria for LAM: No menses, Exclusive breastfeeding, Baby < 6 months.

questions.question: A woman with high individual risk of STIs requests an Intra-Uterine Device (IUD). What is her Medical Eligibility Criteria (MEC) Category for IUD initiation?

options.text: Category 1 (No restriction)
Category 2 (Benefits > Risks)
Category 3 (Risks > Benefits)
Category 4 (Unacceptable Health Risk)

questions.explanation: Initiation of IUD in women with high risk of current STIs is Category 4 due to the risk of Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID).

questions.question: Identify the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) from the list below: (Select all that apply)

options.text: Eradicate extreme poverty and hunger
Achieve universal primary education
Promote gender equality
Reduce child mortality
Digital literacy for all

questions.explanation: MDGs included poverty eradication, education, gender equality, and child mortality reduction.

questions.question: Factors employed by managers to reduce resistance to change include: (Select all that apply)

options.text: Communication and Education
Participation and Involvement
Facilitation and Support
Coercion and Threats

questions.explanation: Reducing resistance involves communication, participation, and support.

questions.question: Arrange the steps of the decision-making process in order:
questions.explanation: Standard decision-making cycle: Define -> Analyze -> Develop -> Select -> Implement -> Evaluate.
questions.hint: Logical flow of solving a problem.
